channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: @barttels2 Twitter app to subscribe, App Store to cancel subscription

@barttels2 If you get Blue using the Twitter app on iOS as an in-app purchase it‚Äôs as easy to cancel as any Apple subscription. FYI: Top Articles is a list of most shared links from accounts you follow in the past x (up to 24) hours. So you get good content without having to doomscroll! https://t.co/67l9j0V2zB

The Top articles feature of Twitter Blue is well worth the price! Now if only there was a Twitter Blue+ that removed promoted tweets (or a way to get Top articles into 3rd party clients)‚Ä¶ https://t.co/aCuct5OOJd
@siracusa Alas, yes. @davewiner has it right https://t.co/nDeRlJUGS4

‚ÄúMost TV shows are not good. The key problems are that too much quality scripting is required, and that the incentives are to try to get the show extended for another season.‚Äù Mini-series FTW https://t.co/DphqCQVFT5
Reading The Demon-Haunted World, trying to figure out if Carl Sagan would be disappointed in us or knew what was coming, realizing the two aren‚Äôt mutually exclusive üìö https://t.co/h6tDS5PatC
@oncology_bg Gotcha. Don't have the full paper so I wasn't sure what their assumptions were.
@oncology_bg Wasn't this a phase 3 design, though? It's a double-blind RCT with overall survival as the primary endpoint. Which part of it is phase 2?
Ima i gorih naƒçina da se provede sreda veƒçe https://t.co/pVoC5n3XRA
@VPrasadMDMPH Or if you've travelled to an area of high prevalence!
@LauraDeming Yes. Cytosol is already full of proteins, some of them quite large (cytoskeleton). It's a bit of an impediment for easy diffusion.

Na dÃ∂aÃ∂nÃ∂aÃ∂≈°Ã∂nÃ∂jÃ∂iÃ∂ juƒçera≈°nji dan pre dve godine, @SkorupanMD i ja smo sa pivom u ruci i strepnjom u srcu poƒçeli da priƒçamo o kovidu, nesvesni punog dijapazona ljudske gluposti koji ƒáe uslediti. Ipak, prvo @prikljucenija1 nije lo≈°e ostarilo. https://t.co/p0sV6itsXB

These summaries of the AACR cancer evolution conference from @mathoncbro are perfect for those of us who are interested in the topic but couldn't attend. Now if only I could find someone like him for every conference, big and small. https://t.co/dfK8YaMoX5
PSA: Every heme/onc trainee should listen to this and read the book, which is a nice counter-balance to The (Overly Optimistic) Emperor of All Maladies. Much shorter, too! https://t.co/19hfk7OBOe
Obiƒçno ne delim ovakve pozive, ali ovo je retka situacija gde relativno mala koliƒçina para mo≈æe puno pomoƒái. https://t.co/CxBNy8sAcc

‚ÄúThe events in the Middle East are not black swans. They were predictable to those who know the region well. At most, they were gray swans or perhaps white swans.‚Äù - @nntaleb on the Arab Spring https://t.co/ESYi7VLVut

Auf, kakav zloƒçin protiv urbanizma. Ne≈°to ozbiljno nije u redu ako u Beogradu nema dovoljno kafiƒáa pa moraju da se ru≈°e pijace. A pijace neƒáe odvuƒái kupce od supermarketa suvenirima veƒá kvalitetnijim proizvodima i boljom uslugom. Ali zna se veƒá pravi razlog za ovakve egzibicije‚Ä¶ https://t.co/N2r6hgpOYr
Zajam za privredni preporod El Salvadora https://t.co/LPRAeG7fkA

A good heuristic for identifying a sociopath is that they‚Äôll quote Mearsheimer and other great power wargamers with a straight face. It‚Äôs all about borders and toy soldiers on comically big maps for them. They also tend to lose actual wars (see recent history of US excursions) https://t.co/n9qRU0ey05

@nntaleb People vote with their feet. VVP had 20 years to make Russia into a country people would want to emigrate into. There‚Äôs massive brain drain instead. So to expect people in a neighboring country to sacrifice themselves so that a sociopath would ‚Äúfeel comfortable‚Äù is idiotic.
@nntaleb Never mind that the invasion occurred precisely because VVP did *not* feel threatened by NATO, as this thread explains. A fatal misjudgment. https://t.co/t3YObqy59m
@alexeyguzey More convenient and efficient than trains as they currently run in most of the US? Sure, but so is my kid‚Äôs mini scooter so it‚Äôs not a high bar.

Where Good Ideas Come From is one of many books from the early 2010s that hasn't aged well. It is important to re-read books you thought were good at least once. Many won't survive the re-reading (applies only to non-fiction) https://t.co/dG7Dgtr81y https://t.co/3oIeyxLYt6
Yet another reminder of @sapinker's delusions. Better angels of our nature indeed‚Ä¶ https://t.co/yOP8BhXtpt

"‚Ä¶it is the Weathervanes who feel most sorry for. Desperately wanting to be 'a part of the discussion', but lacking the tools to do so, ‚Ä¶limiting the scope and breadth of what the rest of us can think and say in the popular press" Strong Aaron Burr vibes https://t.co/h5IfTmiN2Z
Best beer, best chocolate, and now the best passport. Jealous of the Belgians‚Ä¶ https://t.co/8QW2eXUHyq
